qas.question: How is hydrogen produced when there is no atmospheric oxygen?

context:
In the absence of atmospheric oxygen (O
2), in deep geological conditions prevailing far away from Earth atmosphere, hydrogen (H
2) is produced during the process of <a0_0>serpentinization by the anaerobic oxidation<a0_0/> by the water protons (H+) of the ferrous (Fe2+) silicate present in the <a1_0>crystal lattice of the fayalite<a1_0/> (Fe
2SiO
4, the olivine iron-endmember). The corresponding reaction leading to the formation of magnetite (Fe
